RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 18500. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DREAM TOWN had an awkward start, was quickly corrected and landed into a stalking position in the two path, moved right next to the leader and matched strides as they set the pace as a pair, had her head in front when they passed the half mile pole, was challenged by an outside foe at he five sixteenth pole, battled with this rival through the turn and down the stretch, pulled away late and got up in time. VIOLA STAR raced along the rail while off the pace early on, patiently waited for the cue, launched her bid at the half mile pole, improved position while still saving ground on the rail, was driven and encouraged past the quarter pole, was kept on point and was able to out finish the rest of her rivals and earned second place honors. CAJUN ACES stalked the early leaders while racing in the three path in between horses, drew near even terms with the leaders after the half mile pole, bid at the five sixteenth pole, battled for the lead leaving the turn, matched strides while drifting out in the stretch and came up third. KENYA STRIKE stalked the early leaders in the four path, was forwardly placed and nearly co leading along the outside, shuffled back at the half mile pole and ran even after that. PAT HAND GIRL was off a touch slow, was in contention at the three eighths pole and chased through the stretch. WHY WAIT vied for the early lead, was joined by battling rivals on the outside, matched strides until the half mile pole then faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Pat Hand Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: Harden Patricia M and Hargrave Randall

ENTRY.NAME: Viola Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, closed, out finished the rest,

ENTRY.NAME: Dream Town
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward start, stalked, 2w, challenged, led 1/2, btwn, bttld, up

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Aces
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, bid 5-16th, battled stretch, drifted, ended up 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Kenya Strike
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 4w, was forwardly places early, shffld bck, 1/2, even

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 5F Dirt CR: 53. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RAUL'S ENCANTO had an awkward start, bumped the horse in the five post position at the break, vied willingly for the lead, raced out in the three path while setting the pace, shook inside foes and shifted into the two path entering the turn, was challenged by an outside rival, battled with that foe down the stretch, repelled this rival and drew away late. gamely won first place. CURIOUS APRIORITY broke to the outside but was quickly corrected, vied for the lead in the five path with horses to the inside, shook one of the inside rivals and stalked the early pace setter, launched a bid under a hand ride after the three eighths pole, drew near the leader, was encouraged down the stretch but was second best today. DOCE DE LA NOCHE was off a bit slow, was encouraged to leave, rushed up along the fence, had to take back when the early leaders moved into the turn, shifted out at the five sixteenth pole, advanced position into the stretch, was encouraged and asked in the lane and was able to finish third. MALIBU MONEY vied for the lead, settled off the pace, raced in the two path, was in contention at the quarter pole but had no late kick. ALWAYS LOGAN vied for the early lead while racing in between hoses in the two path, settled just off the pace, shuffled back, shifted down to the rail and saved ground while being encouraged but to no avail. CAMALEON trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Doce de la Noche
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, encouraged, rushed, rail, took back, shifted out 3w, 3r

ENTRY.NAME: Malibu Money
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, settled off pace, 2w, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Always Logan
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, btwn, 3w, settled off pce, rail, no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Raul's Encanto
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd strt, vied, led, 3w. rail upper stretch, repelled, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Curious Apriority
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 5w, launched bid after 3/8, gained, second best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 19000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 10, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 10, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Cl aiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLESSED ANNA was sharp out of the gates, was naturally on the lead going into the first turn, was challenged for the lead by an inside competitor nearing the six furlong pole, smartly settled off of the pace and stalked in the two path, rated nicely until she drew beside the early leader at the seven sixteenth pole, raced in between horses at the three eighths pole while being challenged by an outside contender, over powered the early leader at the quarter pole, was challenged by an outside attacker, battled with this contender and matched strides through the lane, where BLESSED ANNA showed heart by not letting her rival ever get the lead, under encouragement and a strong hand ride, was able to stay in front and earn a game win. SEE SASSY RUN stalked the early pace while racing in the three path, advanced position and bid at the three eighths pole, challenged for the lead nearing the quarter pole, was encouraged at the top of the lane with a right handed crop, strongly hand ridden, and encouraged but couldn't get past the eventual winner and had to settle for second. ANN'S STORM was racing in the middle of the pack along the rail early on, was allowed to settle in hands and save ground early, easily improved position down the back side, was encouraged under a hand ride after the three eighths pole, but had no finish in the stretch. AVERI EVER AFTER vied for the early lead, attended to the pace while racing on the rail, was asked at the three eighths pole, was challenged by outside rivals and gave way at the quarter pole. MEG AND CLAIR trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Blessed Anna
ENTRY.COMMENT: sharp, rail, settled, 2w, stalked, bid, battled, finished strong,

ENTRY.NAME: Ann's Storm
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, settled in hands, angled out 1/4, had no finish

ENTRY.NAME: See Sassy Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, launched bid 3/8, challenged 1/4, battled, scnd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Claiming Purse 14000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: B B GUN BULLSEYE broke sharp, settled off of the pace, was rated early, stalked the early leader from the two path, was pressured by an outside rival at the five sixteenth pole, collared the early leader, took command at the quarter pole, drew in front by the top of the lane and maintained the lead through out the stretch run. DONTFORGETRDREAMS stalked the early leader, raced in the three path, improved position along the back side, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, shifted into the four path entering the upper stretch, challenged for the lead at the quarter pole but could make up any ground on the eventual winner, was second best today. LOYAL TO THE CHIEF was sent out for the lead along the rail, could not make it to the front fast enough and had to steady a bit going into the turn, stalked into the stretch and faltered. LUCKY GONE SWEET stalked while racing three wide, bid at the three eighths pole, shifted out in the turn and circled the field to improve position but chased down the lane. DECORATED LADY trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Dontforgetrdreams
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, 2nd tier, bid 3/8, 4 wide, upper, driven, secondbest

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Gone Sweet
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, bid 3/8, circled turn, chased down the lane

ENTRY.NAME: B B Gun Bullseye
ENTRY.COMMENT: sharp, rated, stalked, pressured 3/8, led 1/4, driven, victorious

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 87. Claiming Purse 19500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE DECEMBER 10, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since May 10, 2023 Al lowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUST PASSING THRU stalked the early pace setter from the two path, settled into a set in the second tier, started to improve position after the half mile pole, collared the early leader at the three eighths pole, drew off on command at the five sixteenth mile marker and drew off down the stretch. Won impressively today. GASTOWN was off a bit slow, stayed on the rail, was allowed to find her stride, made one run and closed while saving ground, shifted out five wide in the upper stretch, closed and was up for second. ROYA vied for the lead, secured the rail and ended up in a set in the second tier stalking the leader, could not keep pace with the eventual winner advancing into the turn, angled out and split horses at the five sixteenth pole, but faded late. CHROME SAVAGE was off the pace early and put in a mild bid late. IZEONPOINT was no factor. DADDYMADEMEDOIT showed little. TEXAS BLUEBONNET raced in the two path while setting the pace on the lead, was collared after the five sixteenth pole, and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Gastown
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, rail trip, shifted out 5 wide, upper, closed, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Roya
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, rail, stalked, 2nd tier set, shiftedout,split horses,faded

ENTRY.NAME: Just Passing Thru
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, 2nd flight set, advanced 1/2, collared 3/8, drew off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Claiming Purse 10000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FABLED RULER raced on the rail, stalked the pace, improved along the rail, launched a bid at the half mile pole, challenged for the lead at the quarter, battled down the stretch and prevailed. ROYAL DE BE was keen in the bridle early on, raced up and took the lead in the 3 path, set the pace, was challenged at the quarter pole, battled down the lane under encouragement, stayed on until after the eighth pole then tired and settled for second. JARED THE WARRIOR was off the pace early, raced three wide, moved at the half mile pole, was in contention at the three eighths pole, saved ground and closed up the rail and was able to achieve third place. ROSIE'S BOY showed little. LAKE HAMILTON stalked the pace from the four path, bid a the half, drew near the leader at the three eighths pole, then tired. SACRAMENT made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Fabled Ruler
ENTRY.OWNER: Blue Lion Thoroughbreds Iapetus Racing and Diamond T Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, off pace, stalked, bid 1/2, challenged1/4, battled drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Royal de Be
ENTRY.COMMENT: keen, led, pace, challenged 1/4, battled stretch, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Jared the Warrior
ENTRY.OWNER: Tri-Star Racing LLC and Cimarron TTT Farms LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: offpce, btwn,3w, bid 1/2, closed on the rail, battled, up for 3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAD DECISIONS raced off the pace on the rail, was allowed to settle and race comfortably early, was asked at the half and responded well, closed ground and improved position through the turn, raced in the two path in the upper stretch still stalking a tiring leader, split foes at he eighth pole and drew off late for the win. SINGING GROOM was well off the pace early, raced five wide, made one run and closed while racing on the outside, was widest in the stretch, was kept on point and encouraged to keep closing and responded well and was able to get up for second. CHAMOIS' EMPIRE raced in the four path, mid pack, improved with a mild bid late. ALPHIN was forwardly placed, took control at the quarter pole and tired late. WINNING DANCE trailed early on, raced two wide, closed well. TRIPLE mid pack, showed little. HEZA ROYAL CAT made no impact. KNIGHT OF HONOR vied, led, tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Bad Decisions
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, settled, bid 1/2, improved, split 1/8, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Winning Dance
ENTRY.OWNER: Big Chief Racing LLC and Rocker O Ranch LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Singing Groom
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,5w, one run, widest, closed outside, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Knight of Honor
ENTRY.OWNER: Jones Catherine and Nelson Jr Eric D

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Purse 30000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 10, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 10, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LADY JEOPARDY stalked, took command, drew off. ANOTHER HOT MESS mid pack, closed. IT'SFIFTYSHADETIME mild bid. SAENZ showed little. B'S LIL' BUMBLEBEE vied, led, tired. QUINN ELLA trailed, pulled up. QUINN ELLA WAS VANNED OFF.

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Jeopardy
ENTRY.OWNER: Salome Robert Joseph and Salome Dana
